The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A crag, precipice, steep bank. From kremannumi; overhanging, i.e. A precipice.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
And, even, also, namely.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.

33.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

33.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
33.str2: To feed, pasture. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to pasture; by extension to, fodder; reflexively, to graze.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
33.str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
33.str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

33.str2: To be possessed, be under the power of an evil-spirit or demon. Middle voice from daimon; to be exercised by a d?Mon.

34.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A meeting. From hupantao; an encounter or concurrence.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
34.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: To change my place (abode), leave, depart, remove, pass over. From meta and the base of basis; to change place.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of a derivative of an apparently primary horos; a boundary-line, i.e. a frontier.
